snippet: The small Eastern Shore community of Pocomoke City, Md., has split along racial lines over the firing of the black police chief by the white mayor.
abstract: Town of Pocomoke, Md, has become bitterly divided along racial lines over abrupt dismissal of black Police Chief Kelvin Sewell; many white residents, who make up roughly half of town's roughly 4,100 residents, say firing was not racially motivated, while blacks are calling for Sewell's reinstatement and resignation of Mayor Bruce Morrison; conflict reflects searing conversation about race that is playing out across country.
lead_paragraph: The small Eastern Shore community of Pocomoke City, Md., has split along racial lines over the firing of the black police chief by the white mayor.

headline.main: A Maryland Town Fires Its Black Police Chief, Exposing a Racial Rift
headline.print_headline: A Maryland Town Fires Its Black Police Chief, Exposing a Racial Rift
